channel.title: Javac: file not found: *.java Whenever I try to compile my source. [Mac]
channel.description:
Whenever I type javac *.java into Terminal it says this.
"wchss-iMac-6:Server researcher$ cd /Users/researcher/Desktop/ServerFiles/Server wchss-iMac-6:Server researcher$ javac *.java javac: file not found: *.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options"
Does this mean that the source is not compatible with Macs? D:

item.title: Javac: file not found: *.java Whenever I try to compile my source. [Mac]
item.dc:creator: @Dremorain Dremorain
item.description:
@Dremorain wrote:

no, the source is still compatible. i don’t know a thing about Macs, but your path must be wrong. the same thing happens when you’re on a PC. change the path to your “java/bin” folder and you’ll be set.

Read full topic
item.source: Javac: file not found: *.java Whenever I try to compile my source. [Mac]
